column4: OK, so I accidentally set my resolution to the lowest setting (320 by 125 if I remember correctly) while trying to set it up (I blame the mouse wheel). How do I set it back?
The screen resolution is so bad I can't even see the System menu.
So what exactly do I do?
Am I being ignored due to "lack of common sense" or does anyone know how to set my screen resolution without going to the System menu?
I don't have access to a terminal, guys.
For the third time, I can't see the menus.
I ran displayconfig but I can't see the the dropdown for the resolution setting because the res is so small. How annoying, legend2440. Is there a file I can edit to set the resolution?
what video card do you have (ATi or Nvidia?)
I believe it's an NVIDIA.
google for this query "Envy-NG + Ubuntu"
and once you find it
install it
its a piece of software that will install the Nvidia drivers for you
very simple to use
and should fix your reso problems
Since I can't do anything due to a low resolution, I'll edit the file from a LiveCD and then reboot.
i wouldnt if i were you
unless your experienced linux user
your commting system suicide
I already have the nVidia drivers. Nothing like that. I just accidentally set the screen res too low.
trust me, try Envy-NG
ill post you the link
it will save your day, trust me
here you go: http://packages.ubuntu.com/hardy/all/envyng-gtk/download
